definition:
A stochastic process $\lbrace X(t)\mid t\in T\rbrace$ of real-valued
random variables $X(t)$, where $T$ is linearly ordered, is said have
*independent increments* if for any $a,b,c,d\in T$ such that $a<b<c<d$,
$X(a)-X(b)$ and $X(c)-X(d)$ are independent random variables.

**Remark**. In case when $X(t)$ is monotonically non-decreasing, as in
the case of a counting process, it is customary to write $X(b)-X(a)$ and
$X(d)-X(c)$ instead of the above to emphasize the comparison of two
positive quantities (for example, the numbers of occurrences of a
certain event in some time intervals).
